results.title: The Revenant
results.headline_credit: Canada, Hong Kong, Taiwan and United States of America, 2015
results.brief_description: In the 1820s, a frontiersman, Hugh Glass, sets out on a path of vengeance against those who left him for dead after a bear mauling.

results.title: The Revealing eye
results.brief_description: Surveys the history of cinematography and microphotography with many examples of the strides that have been taken in these fields. The history of the scientific study of motion through the cine-camera. High-speed, and time-lapse cinematography allied with X-ray and the microscope have made possible the study of movements and subjects which the normal eye cannot see. Experiments from 1890 to 1940, when it was possible to slow down the flight of a bullet so that one is seen tapping a piece of glass and passing through before the glass is shattered. Cinematography from space rockets. The use of colour photography in the schlieren technique.

results.title: The Return of the soldier
results.creator_credit: Alan Bridges, Simon Relph, Ann Skinner, Skreba Films, Barry R Cooper Productions and Brent Walker Film Productions
results.brief_description: It is 1916. A shell-shocked soldier (Alan Bates) is sent home to the tranquillity of his English estate, his beautiful but spoilt wife Kitty (Julie Christie) and adoring cousin (Ann-Margret). But he barely remembers Kitty and can only find happiness with his first love (Glenda Jackson), who is from a lower class and now married to a schoolteacher. Kitty, however, wants him back whatever the cost. Adapted by Hugh Whitemore from the novel by Rebecca West, with music by Richard Rodney Bennett. Also stars Frank Finlay and Ian Holm.

results.title: The Return of the god of gamblers [Dubbed]
results.creator_credit: Wong Jing, Jimmy Heung, Golden Harvest and Win's Movie Production
results.brief_description: Ko Chun, the God of Gamblers, returns living a wealthy life but a rival appears, killing his pregnant wife and soon to be son. Before dying, his wife tells him not to gamble for one year and not to reveal his identity as the God of Gamblers. A year almost passes, and the gambler lives a forgiving life, until the man who kills his wife appears, taking revenge into his own hands. Cast includes Chow Yun-Fat, Tony Leung. Dubbed in English.

results.title: The Return of Martin Guerre = Le Retour de Martin Guerre
results.creator_credit: Daniel Vigne, Marcel Dassault Productions, FR3 and SFP
results.brief_description: In rural France during the Hundred Years’ War, an unhappy young man (Gerard Depardieu) vanishes from his village leaving his wife and his farm behind. Nine years later he returns a changed person, ostensibly having fought in the war. Though his appearance has altered beyond recognition, his wife (Nathalie Baye), finding him a much better lover and more responsible man than the one that left, accepts him wholeheartedly. Yet the villagers who knew him suspect he is not the man he claims to be, even though he possesses an insider’s knowledge of their lives. Matters come to a head when charges of deception are laid against him and Guerre is forced to defend his identity or face a death sentence. The ensuing court case of raises questions about the nature of identity, memory, perception, and how the passage of time can blur all three. This film was remade in Hollywood under the title “Sommersby” (1993) (also held in the collection). In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Return of Frank James
results.creator_credit: Fritz Lang, Darryl F. Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: In this exploration of justice and revenge inspired by brotherly love, Henry Fonda reprises his role as Jesse James’ brother, Frank, in Fritz Lang’s sequel to ‘Jesse James’. The film is notable for the screen debut of Gene Tierney, as well as being Lang’s first western and his first film in colour. After his brother, Jesse, is shot and killed by the Ford brothers, Frank takes the law into his own hands when the brothers are pardoned. Franks journey alienates him from family and friends, as well as endangering the lives of those close to him. He has only two people to help his lonely and determined plight, teenage friend Clem (Jackie Cooper), and a newspaper owner’s beautiful daughter (Gene Tierney). Cast includes Henry Fonda, Gene Tierney, Jackie Cooper, Henry Hull and John Carradine.

results.title: The Return of Captain Invincible
results.creator_credit: Philippe Mora, Willarra and Seven Keys
results.brief_description: Captain Invincible was once the world’s greatest super-hero before he was falsely accused of treason and dishonourably discharged from active service 30 years ago. The United States President calls on his childhood hero, now aging and an alcoholic, to save the world from the evil Mr Midnight. Stars Alan Arkin, Christopher Lee with Kate Fitzpatrick, Bill Hunter and Graham Kennedy.

results.title: The Return
results.creator_credit: Sture Rydman, Elizabeth McKay and Jocelyn Films
results.brief_description: Edwardian England, a boarded-up mansion and rumours of ghosts provide some of the necessary ingredients for this compelling suspense film based on two short stories - “Nobody’s House” by A.M. Burrage and “The Middle Toe of the Right Foot” by Ambrose Bierce. A man who is seeking vindication of the man suspected of killing his bride shuts himself in the wedding room and confronts the ghosts of the bride.

results.title: The Restless planet
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Earth revealed”.
The creation of the planets in our solar system has had an enormous impact on the geological structure of the Earth,and the existence of life on the planet. This episode examines the origins of the solar system and planets, and how the Earth and its atmosphere evolved. The Earth and its inter-relationship with the planets is also examined.

results.title: The Restless eye: Eugene Delacroix: a film based on his paintings and his journals
results.creator_credit: Colin Nears, RM Productions and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
Born in France in 1798 and dying in 1863, Eugene Delacroix was one of the most important Romantic painters of his time, earning him the retrospective reputation of, ‘a painter’s painter’ - his work’s being referenced and copied by the likes of Manet, Picasso and Van Gogh. This documentary is based on the journals that Delacroix wrote since age 24 which have since become literary classics in their own right. The writings reveal much of Delacroix’s dilemmas and intentions in his life and art. He was sceptical of progress, disdainful of the masses and scornful of revolution, but also intended to articulate his fascination with the barbarity and violence of ‘humanity’. Declaring, “I’m trying to make a beauty which is not quiet”, Delacroix painted a heady mix of beauty and cruelty with constant movement, colour, and restless energy. Cast includes John Carson as Delacroix.
